info.title: NIAEFEUP Website - Backend API specification
info.description:
This specification documents the available endpoints and possible operations on the website's backend.
For each of the operations, its purpose, security, requests and possible responses are documented.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for authentication management.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for account management.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for event management.

tags.name: Generations
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for generations management.

tags.name: Posts
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for post management.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Endpoints and operations for project management.

get.description: The operation returns an array of accounts, allowing to easily retrieve all the created accounts.

post.description: This endpoint operation creates a new account.

get.description: This endpoint allows the retrieval of a single account using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the account to retrieve

post.description: Replaces sets a new account password

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the account to change the password.

get.description: This endpoint operation allows to check if a given access token is valid, returning the associated account's information.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer authentication token

AUTH/CheckToken/should fail when access.value: {"errors":[{"message":"An error occurred while attempting to decode the Jwt: Invalid JWT serialization: Missing dot delimiter(s)"}]}

post.description: This endpoint operation allows authentication using user's password and email, generating new access and refresh tokens to be used in following requests.
This endpoint operation allows the renewal of the access token, using the currently valid refresh token.

get.description:
The operation returns an array of events, allowing to easily retrieve all the created events.
This is useful for example in the frontend's event page, where events are displayed.

EVENT/GetAllEvents/should return all eve.value: [{"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"id":1}],"slug":"great-event","registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","id":1},{"title":"Bad event","description":"This event was a failure","teamMembers":[],"dateInterval":{"startDate":"27-10-2021"},"thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail2","id":2}]

get.description: This endpoint allows the retrieval of events labeled with a given category. It might be used to filter events in the event page.
get.operationId: EVENT/GetEventsByCategory/should return all events of the category

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category of the events to retrieve

put.summary: Remove a team member from event
put.description: This operation removes a team member of a given event.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event to remove the member from

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: ID of the account to remove

EVENT/RemoveTeamMember/should remove a t.value: {"title":"Great event","description":"This was a nice and iconic event","teamMembers":[],"slug":"great-event","registerUrl":"https://docs.google.com/forms","dateInterval":{"startDate":"28-07-2022","endDate":"30-07-2022"},"location":"FEUP","category":"Great Events","thumbnailPath":"https://example.com/exampleThumbnail","id":1}

get.summary: Get all the school years with recorded generations
get.description:
This returns an array of years with recorded generations,
allowing other operations on the generations themselves.
This operation retrieves the latest generation using its id.

post.description: This operation creates a new generation.

GENERATION/CreateGeneration/should fail.value: {"errors":[{"message":"no generations created yet, please specify school year"}]}

get.description: This operation retrieves the generation using its id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of a generation

delete.summary: Delete a generation by its id
delete.description: Delete a generation by its id, using its id as a parameter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of a generation

patch.summary: Update a generation school year by its Id
patch.description: Update a generation school year, using its Id as a parameter

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of a generation

get.description: This operation retrieves the generation associated with a given school year.

parameters.name: schoolYear
parameters.description: School year associated with a generation

delete.summary: Delete a generation by its school year
delete.description: Delete a generation by its school year, using its school year as a parameter

parameters.name: schoolYear
parameters.description: School year associated with a generation

patch.summary: Update a generation school year by its school year
patch.description: Update a generation school year, using its school year as a parameter

parameters.name: schoolYear
parameters.description: School year associated with a generation

get.description: The operation returns an array of posts, allowing to easily retrieve all the created posts.

POST/GetAllPosts/should return all posts.value: [{"title":"New test released","body":"this is a test post","thumbnailPath":"https://thumbnails/test.png","publishDate":"10-03-2023","lastUpdatedAt":"10-03-2023 21:15:15","id":1,"slug":"new-test-released"},{"title":"NIAEFEUP gets a new president","body":"New president promised to buy new chairs","thumbnailPath":"https://thumbnails/pres.png","publishDate":"10-03-2023","lastUpdatedAt":"10-03-2023 21:15:15","id":2}]

post.description: This endpoint operation creates a new post.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to retrieve

put.description: Update a previously created post, using its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the post to update

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: Short and friendly textual post identifier

get.description: The operation returns an array of projects, allowing to easily retrieve all the created projects. This is useful for example in the frontend project page, where projects are displayed.

put.description:
This endpoint archives a project.
This is useful to mark no longer maintained or complete projects.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to archive

PROJECT/ArchiveProject/should archive th.value: {"title":"Awesome project","description":"this is a test project","teamMembers":[{"name":"Test Account","email":"test_account@test.com","bio":"This is a test account","birthDate":"28-07-2001","photoPath":"https://test-photo.com","linkedin":"https://linkedin.com","github":"https://github.com","websites":[{"url":"https://test-website.com","iconPath":"https://test-website.com/logo.png","id":1}],"id":1}],"slug":"awesome-project","isArchived":true,"technologies":["Java","Kotlin","Spring"],"id":1}

put.description:
This endpoint unarchives a project.
This is useful to mark previously archived projects as active.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the project to unarchive

put.description: This operation adds a team member to a given project.

parameters.name: projectId

parameters.name: accountId
